item.title: Permutation Matrix
item.description: Definition 1 $P \in \mathbb{R}^{n \times n}$ in which only one component in each row is $1$ and the rest are $0$ is called a Permutation Matrix. Basic Properties Orthogonality All permutation matrices are orthogonal matrices: $$P^{-1} = P^{T}$$ Sparseness For sufficiently large $n$, $P \in \mathbb{R}^{n \times n}$ is a sparse matrix.
